markdownRemark.html:
Ingredients

Serves: 4

To fry Potatoes

  • 15-20 baby potatoes
  • 3 tablespoons oil
  • 1/2 teaspoon cumin
  • 1/2 teaspoon turmeric
  • 1 teaspoon red chili powder

To grind

  • 1 teaspoon oil
  • 1 inch cinnamon
  • 1 cardamom
  • 1 clove
  • 1/2 inch fresh ginger
  • 6 garlic cloves
  • 1 medium onion
  • 2 medium tomatoes
  • 2 red chilies
  • 10 cashews - soaked in hot water for 10 minutes
  • Water to blend

For the Gravy

  • 1 teaspoon oil
  • 1 big bay leaf
  • 1 teaspoon cumin powder
  • 1 teaspoon coriander powder
  • 3/4 teaspoon garam masala
  • 3 tablespoons curd
  • 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder
  • 2 teaspoon kasuri methi
  • Salt to taste

Method

  • Cook the potatoes with enough water and little salt for 10-15 minutes. Peel the skin and prick the potatoes with a fork gently to make a surface rough.
  • Add 3 tablespoons oil in a pan. Add cumin, let them splutter and then add 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder and 1 teaspoon red chili powder.
  • Add the potatoes, mix and let it roast for 5 minutes on a medium heat. Set aside the roasted potates.
  • Fry all the ingredients that are to be ground and grind it to a fine paste.
  • Heat oil, add bay leaves and add the ground mixture.
  • Add cumin powder, coriander powder, salt and mix well.
  • Simmer on low-medium heat by stirring ocasionally for 10 minutes until it gets thick.
  • Add curd, garam masala and salt.
  • Add crushed Kasuri methi and finally add the roast potatoes.
  • Lower the flame. Place a tava on the stove and tehn place the pot which has the aloo on top of it. Close the lid and let it dum for 10 minustes.

Tips

  • Pricking the potatoes with a fork before frying gives a beautiful crisp outside.
